Subject: 18 rhino horn pieces (63 kg) seized at O.R. Tambo Airport
Method of Concealment - Details: shipment declared as “HP Cartridges Developers” . The three-piece shipment was taken to the X-ray scanner for non-intrusive inspection, where the image analysis reflected objects resembling the shape of rhino horns. The shipment was taken for physical inspection and upon inspection of the boxes, 18 pieces of rhino horn were found concealed in traditional clothing.

Subject: 1 rhino horn seized in Maluti, one suspect fled the scene

Subject: Nelspruit theft of rhino horns during burglary, 25 February 2016
3 arrested for selling 5 rhino horns - 3 and 105 more found - Equestria, Pretoria
Additional Sources:
Pretoria News, 13 January 2017: Rhino horn accused 'jovial' in court [see attachment]
https://m.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/rhino-farmer-and-wife-killed-on-their-farm-20170820
Method of Concealment - Details:
Detected through a sting operation by the HAWKS where an undercover police acted as potential buyer. 
Van Zyl alleged that the horns belonged to him and the Hawks are verifying the alleged permits that were issued by the Department of Environmental Affairs and matching DNA samples of all the horns with the Rhino DNA Index System (Rhodis).

Subject: 10 Rhino horn - 6.71 kilos in three express parcels - Hong Kong International Airport from Mozambique
Where Found: In Postal Parcel (at postal depot or sorting office)
Method of Concealment - Details: The parcels were declared to contain "wood sample" arriving on different flights on July 26 and July 27 from Pemba, Mozambique, to Hong Kong via Johannesburg, South Africa. Upon examination, Customs officers found the 10 slabs mingled with wood products in the parcels. Each slab was wrapped in aluminium foil and plastic sheets. The 10 slabs were suspected to be cut from two whole rhino horns. It is believed that the smuggler attempted to evade Customs detection by cutting the suspected rhino horns into pieces for delivery in separate consignments.

Subject: 2 Elephant tusks seized in Kruger National Park - 1 Mozambican arrested
Method of Concealment - Details: two elephant tusks hidden in maize meal bags on the back of his bakkie

Subject: 1 elephant poached and poisoned leading to the death of four lions and 110 white backed vultures
18 rhino horns (43 kg) seized in OR Tambo International Airport - South Africa
Method of Concealment - Details: HAWKS received a tip-off. The horns were concealed in his travel bags wrapped in plastic wrap.

Subject: 36 kg rhino horn, 2 frozen tiger cubs, 4 lion pelts and raw ivory seized in Ha Noi - 3 suspects arrested
Where Found: Other (please specify in Method of Concealment Details field)
Method of Concealment - Details: Part of the contraband was sezied form the suspects at a railway station. More contraband was later found as a result of the first seizure at one of the suspect's houses. The wildlife products from South Africa, before moving them by air to Malaysia, Thailand and Cambodia. From these countries, the products were brought by ship and train to Vietnam to avoid detection.
